docs.snippet: We are still without any notification of the arrival of the expected European steamers, the Niagara and the Alps, at Halifax. The line of telegraph between Bangor and points further east was reported down last night, with no prospect of immediate...
docs.lead_paragraph: We are still without any notification of the arrival of the expected European steamers, the Niagara and the Alps, at Halifax. The line of telegraph between Bangor and points further east was reported down last night, with no prospect of immediate repair. The latest advices from Halifax are to Saturday evening, at which time the steamers had not been heard from.

docs.snippet: The Naples correspondent of the Times writes of King Bomba. The intelligence which reaches me from Bari is to the effect that the King is suffering from a disease in the articulation of the thigh bone, producing such extreme pain as to render life...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Naples correspondent of the Times writes of King Bomba. The intelligence which reaches me from Bari is to the effect that the King is suffering from a disease in the articulation of the thigh bone, producing such extreme pain as to render life almost insupportable. This disease arises from an attack which his Majesty had some years bask.

docs.snippet: The Grinding Committee has become the chief attraction of the Capitol for a season. Legislation is stupefied and slow both in the Senate and the Assembly chamber. But the wheel of the Committee of Nine turns perpetually, and the local bills are...

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT ALBANY.; New-York and Brooklyn Legislation--A Pile Ready for Third Reading--The Paid Jury Bill Killed--City Railroads, &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Grinding Committee has become the chief attraction of the Capitol for a season. Legislation is stupefied and slow both in the Senate and the Assembly chamber. But the wheel of the Committee of Nine turns perpetually, and the local bills are already almost exhausted. Unless the bridges, and tunnels, and City railroads go in, there will be nothing whatever to feed their mill with in a few days.

headline.main: LAW REPORTS.; COURT CALENDAR UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT. Decision in Admiralty. SURROGATE'S COURT. SUPERIOR COURT MARINE COURT. SUPREME COURT

docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Times: DEAR SIR: When I returned to the stage some few weeks since, I announced as the cause, in a letter which originally appeared in the Troy Times, and was extensively copied throughout the country, the destitution...

headline.main: Letter from Charles H. Weeks, and His Mother, Mrs. Roxana Weeks, of Montrose, Penn.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: DEAR SIR: When I returned to the stage some few weeks since, I announced as the cause, in a letter which originally appeared in the Troy Times, and was extensively copied throughout the country, the destitution and sufferings of my mother and sisters.

docs.snippet: Mr. FAYETTE ROBINSON, the second victim of the poisoning affair at Mrs. BETHAM's boarding houses in Fourteenth-street, was a gentleman of consideration literary reputation. He was a native of Virginia highly educated and talented. Some twelve or...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. FAYETTE ROBINSON, the second victim of the poisoning affair at Mrs. BETHAM's boarding houses in Fourteenth-street, was a gentleman of consideration literary reputation. He was a native of Virginia highly educated and talented. Some twelve or fourteen years ago, after a long period of travel, be came to this City and accepted an engagement in the office of the Tribune.

docs.snippet: BILLS PASSED. In relation to the duties and salaries of the Clerks of Police Courts of New-York. To amend the act for the protection of the St. Regis Indians. To continue tile act authorizing the sale of the Arsenals in New-York and Albany.
docs.lead_paragraph: BILLS PASSED. In relation to the duties and salaries of the Clerks of Police Courts of New-York. To amend the act for the protection of the St. Regis Indians. To continue tile act authorizing the sale of the Arsenals in New-York and Albany.

docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Times : Since the destruction of the Quarantine Hospitals, residences and offices last September, and especially since the commencement of the present session of the Legislature, the people of this port, and of the State...

headline.main: Removal of Quarantine--What are the Dangers of Infection?

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times : Since the destruction of the Quarantine Hospitals, residences and offices last September, and especially since the commencement of the present session of the Legislature, the people of this port, and of the State at large, have felt no little interest as to the questions involved in the project of removing Quarantine.

docs.snippet: A BOY'S ADVENTURES.-A Mr. PHILLIPS, of Providence, arrived here on Wednesday morning in search of his son, a lad of about 14 years of age, who had been missing from his home for a week. For the first two or three days Ihe parents suffered the...
docs.lead_paragraph: A BOY'S ADVENTURES.-A Mr. PHILLIPS, of Providence, arrived here on Wednesday morning in search of his son, a lad of about 14 years of age, who had been missing from his home for a week. For the first two or three days Ihe parents suffered the greatest distress, fearing that their son was drowned.

docs.snippet: The Journal of Commerce, noticing the refusal of the Board of Aldermen to confirm any nomination for City Inspector, says: "The Board are evidently bound to Dr. MORTON, the present incumbent of the office, and according to present appearances will...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Journal of Commerce, noticing the refusal of the Board of Aldermen to confirm any nomination for City Inspector, says: "The Board are evidently bound to Dr. MORTON, the present incumbent of the office, and according to present appearances will allow no one to be put in his place.
